report.paper_summary: The authors focus on adversarial attacks on dialog systems. The authors first present a method that generates universal adversarial triggers with language model loss or selection criteria. The proposed attack method can generate natural-looking attacks. Furthermore, the authors propose a defense model, which can improve the robustness of conversational models.
report.summary_of_strengths:
1. The authors present a method to generate natural-looking attacks for dialog systems, with satisfactory coherency and relevancy. 
2. The proposed defender is effective for both adversarial agents and regular users.
report.summary_of_weaknesses:
1. The attack effectiveness of the proposed models seems to be limited, with no more than 50%. 
2. The authors only compare the proposed model with UAT. It would be more convincing if the authors can compare the proposed method with other competitive baselines.
